title: Mark Hughes: When first's the worst. Why F1 drivers lose to slower team-mates
summary: When you're falling behind, there's less risk in trying something different. Which is why F1 drivers can ace grands prix and still get beaten by a slower team-mate â€” as Oscar Piastri and Lewis Hamilton know too well

qa_pairs.question: What strategy might a driver employ when they are falling behind in performance during a race?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: Trying something different with their race strategy.
wrong_options: Sticking to the same strategy as their teammate.

qa_pairs.question: Which two drivers are mentioned as having experienced being beaten by slower teammates?
In Formula 1, how can a slower teammate sometimes outperform a faster driver in the same team?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: By adopting a different strategy that proves more effective in the race.
wrong_options: By having better car performance overall.
By receiving team orders to prioritize their position.
By being more experienced in race craft.
